Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: WinchesterCouple
Reviews.Content: Motel is older but has been updated. Our room was clean, nicely decorated, flat screen TV, etc. It is behind the restaurant so is very quiet. There are nice mountain views from rooms on the back side of the building and real nice grassy areas. Pool,spa, sauna and cabana area was great. Front desk clerk - Chris - made several suggestions (menu items at restaurant, local hiking areas, & shows to see) that helped make our stay wonderful. Breakfast was good. Central location made it easy to see sights on strip and downtown. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very "Outback"”
Reviews.Author: Jazzwalker
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel by taxi and as my luggage was unloaded, an employee quickly came out to tell the driver to take me down the hill and then up and around. It is quite a distance to walk, especially if you have luggage. I was given a ticket for a free drink at the pub nearby. Since I was alone, I was hesitant to go get a drink, even if it was for a soda. I don't think a woman traveling by herself should be in a pub drinking alone. This place is a basic motel. The pool was nice to swim in and enjoyed the country feel of the area. I doubt if I will come back to this place. The employees were pleasant, and everything was neat and clean. There are restaurants, a large Walmart, and entertainment walking distance from the motel. It was more basic than I preferred and being so far from the road was odd. Overall, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MJFrog55
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for someplace great to spend most of your vacation at, this isn't it. If you're looking for a good, fair-priced, clean place to sleep, shower, and relax after a long day on the town, this is your best bet. When you go to Branson, there's too much to do in one week's visit, and you're not going to waste your time lounging at the hotel. But this place is right on the strip, yet set back off the road and traffic. However, the Outback Pub is a few hundred feet from the front of the building with live music nightly outside in warmer weather and unless you are into late nightly nightlife, you'll want to request a room on the backside of the building. They have an outdoor pool, hot tub, and SAUna to relax in after a long day on your feet or to take in after one of the many local shows. The owner is very nice, knows the area, and can provide good information on where to take a ride to see the best views of the countryside. One of his best recommendations was a loop that included Eureka Springs, AR. What a cool town! Our next trip to Branson will again include a stay here (on the back side)! - Paul & Bobbie

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are decieving...”
Reviews.Author: jackson1109
Reviews.Content: The Good: The staff in the office were very nice & welcoming. The room/bathroom were very clean upon entering the room. Pool area was nice. Breakfast was good. Hotel is set off the road, rarely heard any traffic on the strip. The Bad: Our reservation was almost mixed up with another until I realized we were looking at someone else's reservation slip. We stayed in a Family suite; neither of the sofa beds were made prior to our arrival. Housekeeping was sketchy; our trash was missed one day, a broom was left behind another. The Ugly: Dinner prices at the restaraunt. Yikes! The sofa bed were as if we were sleeping on the springs & rails.

Reviews.Title: “Worth checking out, if you are looking for convenience,a nice pool, & comfortable temp living quarters”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn_Bekka
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews you may read about hotels are not so pleasant. The outrageous claims made by travelers puzzle me. What do you expect for $60.00 a night? How about $45.00? My trip to Branson this year was a great pleasure. I arrived at the Outback hotel a week before prime season. During my visit I paid $45.00 a night for a A/C large room w/ 2 comfortable queen beds. We had a standard bathroom. However, the water pressure, as well as the temp was perfect. After my morning walk on their premises(15 acres of wooded grounds), my family and myself had access to continental style breakfast.(Which was adequate enough to get your morning going.) Most of the staff was friendly, especially Shannon and Noel. (Please Keep in mind these locals are recovering from a Tornado, and have a lot of extra duties to take care of.) After taking in a day of shopping, shows, and other tourist attractions. My family and I would return to a clean room, a wonderful heated pool, hot tub, sauna and covered pavilion. This hotel is definitely worth checking out, if you are looking for convenience, privacy, a nice pool, and a comfortable temporary living quarters. If you have any additional questions call before your stay. The staff is more than happy to accommodate you.****The price I paid was through priceline, and also pre- holiday season.*********

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Sandra D
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Outback Roadhouse motel and it was a wonderful stay. Walking distance to many eating places and shows. The rooms are a bit outdated, but they are very clean. Our room was by the heated outdoor pool, jacuzzi and covered pavillion. The pool was clean and so was the jacuzzi. We practically had the pool and jacuzzi to ourselves the whole time we were there. The room was very affordable (under $60 a night) for us with our discounts. A free hot breakfast in the morning hit the spot. The property that the motel is on is set right of the 76 strip, but it is alot of acreage, so the motel is away from all the noise and traffic of the strip. The Outback Roadhouse restaurant also located on the property was awesome. Prices are on the high side for the meals, but worth every penny. Loved the quail and lamb. I would stay there again and again if I could ever go to Branson again.

Reviews.Title: “Little older, but a GREAT place.”
Reviews.Author: brett_levi
Reviews.Content: We have a family of seven, and I think we have our new "spot" in Branson. It is hard to find an affordable place for a large family to stay, without having to get two rooms. Our room had a full kitchen, dining and living room. There were two pull out couches and a king size bed. It was only $90 or so. That is $40-60 less than most family suites, and it is much nicer than the other family suite at a comparable price. There is not any dishes, utensils, cookware, etc. The sheets were clean, however, part of them had stains. That was really the only turn off. We didn't visit he pool, but it is a standar small pool with a nice covered dining/sitting area. Checkout is not until 11:00. That was nice, since we spent a late night at the ER for some stitches. Consequently, we did not get a chance to try the breakfast. They do give a 10% discount on dining at the Outback restaurant next door. It is back from the strip a little bit, so it is quiet. It is right in the middle of town, which means easy access to shows, the Landing, or he alternate routes around town. Staff was great. I am pretty critical of places, but our one night stay was pleasant we WILL be returning to this hotel on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “dirty and dreary”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl535
Reviews.Content: What the pictures show is actually the office. The rooms were a typical old style motel, nothing rustic or cool just a regular all in one complex with the doors outside and a window. Inside our suite it had a very musty smell, our first reaction was it stinks in here. There were hairs on the floor of the bathroom, in the drawers, and between the sheets. Dirt in corners, just rather unclean. But that's just housekeeping. Maybe that was a fluke. But the real issue is how outdated, dark, and dreary it was. The dark colors just added to the feeling of it being unclean. I guess this place is just really getting old. And when the air was on it blew the curtains so we could see people pulling up in their cars and walking to their room. We fixed it with some careful situating but not before one man waved in at us. The price needs to be lowered or the place updated to stay competitive.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Graham1050
Reviews.Content: We searched online for a motel in Branson and liked what we saw at the Outback Roadhouse Motel site. We called late one night & talked to Janet, the manager. We stayed 5 nights in a queen suite. After a couple of housekeeping mishaps, which were quickly rectified by the management, we totally enjoyed our stay. My husband loved walking "Gizmo" the resident dog! The breakfast room has some serving glitches in the way it is laid out...but overall the food was good. We would recommend this as a well-managed motel on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Looks are decieving”
Reviews.Author: mrsdebbie65
Reviews.Content: Don't let the outside deceive you this motel is WONDERFUL on the inside. We stayed in a basic suite because we needed 2 rooms (I snore and it keeps everyone up) Each room had their own bathroom therefore we didn't bother the others when we awoke at night. The trip was delightful from check in to check out. We will definately stay again. Maybe stay in a different room. :)

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: arladie
Reviews.Content: It's not the Hilton and it's not motel no tell. The rooms are priced right, clean, and quiet. $134.00 total for a Friday and Saturday night in late july. Family of four poolside. Breakfast was okay...it filled the hole untill later in the day when we were out and about. If you like luxury and are willing to pay for it, then I suggest going someplace else. If you are an average Joe like me and don't want to spend your vacation money on a fancy room then this is the place. The pool was really nice as well!

Reviews.Title: “Lost my business....”
Reviews.Author: sabruce01
Reviews.Content: For several years, this was the only place I would stay while in Branson. Yes, you are off the strip, but still "on" the strip and it is quiet. However, our last stay will be our last. New ownership/management needs to work on their people skills! We were treated rude, the room has a terrible smell upon check-in, only had 3 towels and it was like pulling teeth to get a 4th towel! (There were 4 of us) The breakfast was cold and they skipped cleaning our room the day before we left! The Pub used to be a nice place to sit and enjoy some music on the deck, but when we were there, we could not hear the musician because of the loud drunks which I believe were locals. Again, they have lost my business and I have stayed there 3-5 times a yeaer for over 5 years!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Affordable Place To Stay In Branson Mo”
Reviews.Author: funnyrau
Reviews.Content: Great place, clean, quiet (off the road), friendly helpful staff. I'll stay again if We ever get back down to Branson again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the secluded feeling....yet right on The Strip!”
Reviews.Author: the_hunters2006
Reviews.Content: 2nd time to stay at hotel....very nice accomodations. We stayed in the jacuzzi suite....rooms were spacious, fridge, microwave, 2 TV's, couch. Love having the restaurant and pub just right up the way....so convenient!

Reviews.Title: “peaceful”
Reviews.Author: kimakers68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a diamond in the rough. It is very secluded and off the road. When we checked in the hotel gave us free drink coupons to the pub house.. Nice full breaksfast for the next morning. Pool is heated and hot tub was great location--- even had a sauna!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a great place to stay in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: brazens4me
Reviews.Content: This was the best place we have ever stayed in Branson! The management (Janet & Gizmo) was very attentive! The view was great, the pool and hot tub were clean and warm. We stayed in the king/jacuzzi suite, and it was very clean, had 2 tvs, microwave, minifridge, couch that made into bed, and chairs. NO complaints whatsoever! The Outback Oyster Bar & Steak house is delicious! gator tail -- mmm,mmm! Thanks for a great trip -- can't wait to come back again next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: hzstyle
Reviews.Content: We didnt have a reservation ahead of time they had one room left which was a smoking room. Of which we really didnt want and the guy said let me see what i can do. He switched us rooms with another couple who was checking in. They said since we had a child it was better that way. The rooms were nice sized only down fall was the beds. But for the price of around 50 a night I guess you get what you pay for. Great location right on the strip. The resturant had great food the office has discounts on alot of shows.

Reviews.Title: “Meh. Would probably stay again.”
Reviews.Author: spisovatelka
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and had all the expected accommodations, aside from a microwave and fridge. The staff was very friendly and left the key for us to get into our room because we arrived after their office hours. Nothing really special, good nor bad.

Reviews.Title: “You could do better at lower prices”
Reviews.Author: YardLover
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms. Uncomfortable beds. Overpriced for the Family Suite. Too bad the room was not as clean as the pool. Try another place.

Reviews.Title: “We were robbed”
Reviews.Author: cybrbikr2
Reviews.Content: While staying at this hotel we were robbed of all our luggage by an employe with a key to our room. The management claims they are not responsible. We will never stay there again and will continue to tell our friends and anyone else to stay away from the Outback properties in Branson!

HotelInfo.Name: Outback Roadhouse Motel and Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 1914 W Hwy 76, Branson, MO 65616
